Goldman they plan to shift a portion of employees to permanently remote positions after the pandemic. As a result, many companies will need to find a way to securely and easily connect employees to corporate networks. Goldman points to three companies leading enterprise network infrastructure manufacturing: Cisco, which develops a plug-in box to connect to employer networks; HPE, which makes the Arbua Remote Access Point; and Juniper Mist, which makes a plug-in that allows employees to use corporate networks without disconnecting from personal Wifi. Goldman predicts these companies will lead innovation and market penetration. Additionally, at-home infrastructure might even allow for employees to have a "potentially much better home Wifi experience" ...
